    Projects

    I have been fortunate to work on a number of interesting projects with some remarkable people. There’s a bit of a divide - my prior work was mostly exeperimental, while my current work is mostly computational.

    Here’s a flavor of some of the projects I’ve worked on:

    Deep Models of Protein Evolution

    Using Deep models to learn about protein evolution

    Date: September 2024

    Status: Ongoing

    GitHub: username/repository

    This project sought to extend classical models of protein Evolution (LG, WAG) using deep neural networks. Classical models of protein evolution assume that sites evolve independently. On the other hand, protein language models (e.g. ESM) are great at capturing dependencies between sites, but are unable to describe evolution along a tree, or the time aspect of evolution. We bridge this divide and create a model that inherits the best of both worlds - it can model evolution between sequences along a tree, and can capture dependencies between sites.

    Tags

    Proteins, Deep Learning, Evolution
